pullRequest.body:
We show that the automorphism group of a fiber functor is isomorphic to the limit of the automorphism groups of all Galois objects.

From this we deduce that the automorphism group of a fiber functor acts transitively on the fibers of connected objects. This is the last essential step towards showing that a fiber functor induces a fully faithful embedding into the category of finite `Aut F`-types.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

using the following format:

-->

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9430091274/job/25977221302)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9430091274/job/25977221557)

In order to define this limit, instead of ulifting+using the limit API, what would you think of using the `Functor.sections` API? (regardless of universes, this is a well defined type, and we have an instance `Group (F ⋙ forget GroupCat.{u}).sections` which is defined in `Algebra.Category.GroupCat.Limits`)
I pushed an attempt. Do you think it's better this way?
Yes, it looks better to me!
As we replaced `limit` by `sections`, the docstring should be updated. Otherwise, the PR looks good to me.
Updated the docstring and renamed one of the isomorphisms.
The docstring should make it clear this is about `Function.sections`.

This is a type, so that it should be capitalized:
```suggestion
noncomputable def AutGalois : Type (max u₁ u₂) :=
```
Changed it in the latest commit, also fixed related names.

```suggestion
/-- The monoid isomorphism between endomorphisms of `F` and the (multiplicative opposite of the)
```

Coding style: infix operators have to be before line breaks.
```suggestion
    F.map (AutGalois.π F { obj := A, pt := a } (autMulEquivAutGalois F f).unop).hom a =
      f.hom.app A a := by
```
